comments.body: Quote from: poorman1 on September 15, 2022, 07:56:44 PMHello community, I have a little confusion so plz help me to solve this. What is Merit and how do we get and what is a benefit Quote from: theymos on January 24, 2018, 11:00:11 PMIn addition to activity, everyone now has a merit score, and you need both a certain activity level and a certain merit score in order to reach higher member ranks. The required scores are:RankRequired activityRequired meritBrand new00Newbie10Jr Member301Member6010Full Member120100Sr. Member240250Hero Member480500LegendaryRandom in the range 775-10301000You get merit points when someone sends you some for one of your posts. Additionally, when someone sends you merit points, half of those points can be sent by you to other people.By the way welcome to the forum and I hope you enjoy your stay here and I will advice you to check out this thread  Beginners & Help + Encyclopedia [UPD: +Electrum Board it's a great to start from it has been of great help to me.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Hello Poorman, let me pretend or believe that you are a genuine newcomer and let me not also refer you to other links for further reading. I understand that most newbies find it difficult to open links to read. So I will give you a direct answer in addition to what have been given you already. My answers are in the context of the forum.What is merit? Merit system is a system introduced by the admin of the forum to curtail the rate of spamming in the forum, it also encourages quality posting and conversation in the forum and then enables the growth of the members in the forum in terms of ranks.Why do you need merits Merit is not compulsory that you must have it, but if you want to grow from one level to another you need it to be able to rank up.How do you get merits You get merits by making quality posts, though quality post is totally subjective because what is quality to me might not be quality to the second man below my reply.  But try your best to make posts that solve problems, answer questions and generally contribute to an ongoing discussions. With that you can be able to recieve merits. You have a good stat, 2 posts, 2 activities, 2 merits. I wish you would keep it up and not betray the kind gesture of Ognasty.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on September 15, 2022, 08:11:14 PMThis question has come up several times on the forum. Several?  Man, if anyone is curious as to how many times merit has come up as the sole topic of a thread, just search the Meta section for "merit" and take a look at everything going back to January 2018.  Threads like this one have thankfully become less common in the last year or two, but there was a time when the Meta section's first page was full of them.OP, if you ever find yourself wondering how to earn merits (because it isn't as easy as some people would have you believe), look at the post histories of some of the highest merit earners and pay close attention to how they write, what they're writing about, and--this is also important--what section they're posting in.  All of those factors in addition to how often you post will be a pretty good indicator of what it takes to earn merits.Dammit, this info and more has already been stickied in Meta.  Don't people look before making threads like this one?Quote from: FatFork on September 16, 2022, 08:47:01 PMGood lord, he made his first two forum posts and is already being accused of ban evasion on his alt account. This has to be a record!  I doubt it.  There have been members exposed so fast that it'd make me slap my head again if I could remember where to find examples to link to.  Good catch.
